intro: Parasenecio weiningensis, commonly known as the Weining parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in mountainous areas with cool, moist climates. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
